topics.body:
"@liamwhite1":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/558f608a63687218540013d1#post_558f608a63687218540013d1
It just seems like it's a huge time waster having to convert complex formulas into basic math.

It must just be C++ in that case; I've had a couple severe fuckups where say for instance example it compounds interest for a bank account continuously and it fucked up hard.  I still remember that cause what the equation the professor gave me on paper worked, but when you plugged it in it gave me that the person had gotten a hundred thousand dollars in 5 years.

topics.body:
"@liamwhite1":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/558f64aa6368724e60000198#post_558f64aa6368724e60000198
Oh this might interest you, but a while back intel started investing in special types of chips that emulate how neurons work and are planning on in the long run having them as part of a processor.

Quantum processing is good for crunching lots and lots of numbers.

The reason why this type of chip would be good in the long run in imagine a computer that can tell you exactly where things fucked up.  Not in a "81 bugs in the code!  81 bugs!  Take one down!  Pass it around! 108 bugs in the code!" but rather a "81 bugs in the code!  Take one down! 0 bugs in the code!" sort of way.
